info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 27 at 12:02AM EST until December 28 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg SC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in North Carolina... Broad River In NC At Boiling Springs affecting Cleveland County. .Runoff from recent heavy rainfall continues to produce rapid rises along the Broad River. Flooding is now expected overnight into Wednesday. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Broad River in North Carolina at Boiling Springs. * WHEN...From early this morning to just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Action Stage. The Broad River is beginning to flood residential yards located off of Abe`s Mountain Rd. At 12.0 feet, Minor Flood Stage. Broad River floodwaters may be approaching the base of residential home foundations between Abe`s Mountain Rd. and the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 11.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early this morning to a crest of 12.6 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.7 feet on 08/29/1949. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 1215 PM EST.
